ovdesc.p: The AM.GROUP.PORT application allows grouping the portfolios so that the consolidation of the portfolios as a group can be monitored.
The selection of the portfolios to be included in the group can be made in 2 ways.
1. Personal Portfolios - These can be entered individually in the field SEC.ACC.NO.

2. Dynamic Portfolios - These can be included by defining the selection criteria for the portfolios to be included, based on the fields in the file SEC.ACC.MASTER. For this the fields DYN.FLD.NAME, DYN.OPERAND, DYN.VALUE, DYN.SUB.FUND and DYM.MAIN.FUNC are used.
Based on these selection criteria, the portfolios included in a group are maintained in the file AM.GROUP.PORT.CONCAT.

In additions, the portfolios included can be checked for the Account Officer voilation. This check will be performed only if the field ACCOUNT.OFFICER (Field 1) is entered. In this case, the portfolios included should either
-belong to the Account Officer entered in field ACCOUNT.OFFICER (Field 1).
-the portfolio's included should belong to the Account officer's whose hierarchy level in the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER Application is below the Account officer for whom the Group is created.

The axis of the support model must match with the axis of the group level matrix.
i.e. AXIS.X of the support model must match with AXIS.X of the group model, same rule applies for AXIS.Y also; else error message is raised.
Group matrix can have two axis and the supporting matrix can have both or any one of the group matrix axis, but it can’t be the other way.
Mandatory field because rebalancing must happen at group level and maximising the tax benefits must happen at sub portfolio level.

If a link matrix is attached to any one of the model i.e. either supporting model or group level model, then a link matrix of the same type (axis should be in line with the attached linked matrix) has to be attached to the same axis member of the other model.

Allows the user to specify more than one portfolio for a particular Group. The Portfolio entered must have the same ACCOUNT.OFFICER as created for the Group.
If the field Account officer holds a value, then the field SEC.ACC.NO holds only those portfolios which has this Account Officer.
If not, the Account officer of the Group must be higher in the hierarchy which is specified in the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER file.

p.p: Optional Input. Must exist in the SEC.ACC.MASTER file.
Any portfolio input must belong to the Account officer, that is identified in the associated ACCOUNT.OFFICER field.
If group type holds a value then the portfolios must be linked to a AM.PORT.TYPE
Must be at least one portfolio without a tax wrapper if it is a rebalancing group.

If the field RBL.TO.DEF.PORT in AM.PARAMETER is set to yes, then the field SEC.ACC.NO must have at least one portfolio with port type defined in DEF.PORT.TYPE in AM.PARAMETER. A group cannot have two portfolios with default port type.

desc.p: Indicates the products that need the Positive and Negative positions to be consolidated seperately. Multivalued to allow the inputt of more than one Product

Presently the Portfolio Consolidation was performed only for the products AC, FD, FX, MM, SC and RP. The values entered here should correspond to one the above values. By Default each product will be consolidated with Positive and Negative Positions together unless otherwise specified in this field.
The value entered here should exist in EB.PRODUCT
Presently allowed values are AC, FD, FX, MM, SC and RP
